sharingConfig.title: Bed and breakfast in Richmond · ★4.72 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 shared baths

html.htmlText:
24,000+ HAPPY GUESTS (all wonderful guests, except for that one ;)

* WE ARE LICENSED & INSURED

2017 North American Best Guest House (top 10)

Exodus Adventures Award of Distinction 2016.

2019 West Coast Guest House (Best Value)

2015 Global Nomads Top 100 Honors

2014 Wanderlust Destination Award

" Voted Vancouver's Best BnB (website hidden) 2013"

"Family friendly BnB "

”it reminds us of home” - Brigitte & Gerard, Paris, France (2011)

If you're looking for a clean room in a safe and convenient neighborhood close to both the airport as well as the bustling culture and plethora of dining options that central Richmond has to offer, then stay at Dejavu!

We are just steps to the bus stop. From there it's a 5-minute ride to Richmond Center and the Canada Line which whizzes you downtown in less than half an hour. We are less than 10 minutes from Vancouver and also from the airport by car.
You will have use of the outdoor pool (seasonal), deck and outdoor fireplace (GAS STOVE NOT INCLUDED). Since Covid we do not offer meals. The bathroom may be shared depending on whether or not we have other guests at the same time. We offer wifi and free visitor parking.
••••••••
We have a small dog who is very friendly and well-behaved. Be forewarned, he will probably bark at you upon your arrival, but give it a couple of minutes and he'll be wanting you to play ball with him. Our little guy is non-shedding so people allergic to pet fur are typically fine around him.
••••••••
Amenities & Details:

•Thermostat / Heater in Each Room
•Dishwasher
•Swimming Pool (Seasonal)
•WIFI
•Housekeeping
•Linens Provided
•Hot Water Kettle
•Microwave
•Parking On Site
•Refrigerator
•Soap / Shampoo
•Toaster
•Towels
••••••••
•Grocery, Starbucks, bank, restaurants, pub, nail and hair salon all within 3 kms.
•We are a 5-minute drive from the Richmond Olympic Oval.

•5 minutes by Skytrain to River Rock, Western Canada's biggest Casino Resort. Play the best table games, over 1,000 slots, high limit VIP rooms and horseracing stakes. Open 24 hours a day, seven days a week.

•10 minutes to Whale Watching (Steveston Seabreeze Adventures)

•Each suite has a locking door with keys, so come and go as you please.
••••••••
NOTE: We often have family staying with us, so the calendar may not be accurate. Please inquire for specific dates.
We’re more a guest house than BnB., with a twist of Fawlty Towers sprinkled in. We don’t claim to be perfect, but we do offer an authentic experience with a regular Canadian family.
We do our best to keep nature out, but we do not use pesticides in or around the home. Sometimes nature happens and you should be ok with that before booking.

listingLocationVerificationDetails.verifiedHelpHtml: We verified that this listing’s location is accurate.

verifiedHelpModalContent.title: How listings are verified
verifiedHelpModalContent.body:
Listings are verified after the Host submits photos or videos to show their place is where they say it is––and they have access to it.

In some cases, a listing can be verified if guest reviews confirm its location, the Host provides extra documents, or if the listing is managed by a company that signs an agreement.

This process has safeguards, but is not a guarantee that every detail on the listing is accurate. Learn about listing verification

section.title: Things to know
section.houseRulesSubtitle: You'll be staying in someone's home, so please treat it with care and respect.

html.htmlText: Guests must load AirBnB app into phone.

items.title: Additional requests
items.subtitle:
How’s your wonderful day?
Check Out Notes:
• 11 am check out.
• close & lock window.
• turn off lights.
• leave key in room & lock door. 
• leave cash payment for snacks, water, pop, etc. 
Thank You.
Happy Travels!
Tammy & Will

section.safetyAndPropertySubtitle: Avoid surprises by looking over these important details about your Host's property.

items.title: Exterior security cameras on property
items.subtitle: “As per our license we live onsite (with children). The property is a shared space with multiple guests. Purpose: deterrent, safety and liability. Outdoor: front yard, driveway & front door. Backyard entrance, including pool area and outdoor fireplace. Thanks for understanding health & safety first. ”

section.about:
• 24,000 + HAPPY GUESTS (all wonderful, except for that one ;)

WE ARE LICENSED & INSURED 

2017 North American Best Guest House (top 10).

Exodus Adventures Award of Distinction 2016

2015 Global Nomads Top 100 Honors

2019 North America Best Guest House Top 50 

2014 Wanderlust Destination Award

" Voted Vancouver's Best BnB (website hidden) 2013"

________________________________________


We're quiet, friendly and love to travel. Our native language is English, but also speak French, some Cantonese, as well as a little Mandarin and Spanish. We embrace all cultures and lifestyles, having lived in places as diverse as Lille (France), Indonesia, New York, Hong Kong, London, Taipei, and Thailand. We look forward to making your stay with us as pleasant, convenient, and affordable as possible (local hotels $200 - $500 night). We’re just a regular Canadian family. 

Activities while staying at Dejavu are abundant. You can do anything from spending the day whale watching or kayaking on the ocean, to hiking and biking through the lush rainforest around Vancouver, or hike to the top of the 4,000 foot Grouse Mountain and take in the spectacular view above the city. If relaxing is more the idea, a game of golf on championship greens or a relaxing treatment at one of the local spas might be a nice alternative. 

Let Dejavu be your base to explore its many wonders!

• Richmond Night Market 
• Richmond Olympic Oval Training Center 
• Grocery, Starbucks, bank, restaurants, pub, nail / hair salon 
• Shopping Malls: Richmond Center, Lansdowne,Yaohan Center, Aberdeen Mall 
• Golden Village, 300 + restaurants featuring cuisine from all corners of the globe 
• Historic Steveston Fishing Village, fresh seafood available right from the boat! 
• Steps from Fisherman's Wharf is "one of the best little Sushi restaurants outside of Japan"
• Whale Watching (Steveston Seabreeze Adventures) 
• River Rock Casino, Western Canada's biggest Casino Resort 
• Thrangu (Tibet) Monastery
• Mountain biking: UBC, Seymour, Lulu Isle dyke 
• UBC Museum of Anthropology 
• Queen Elizabeth Park and Conservatory 
• Granville Island 
• Vancouver Canucks, Canadians and Lions 
• Stanley Park 
• Gastown 
• Chinatown 
• Lynn Valley Suspension Bridge 
• Capilano Suspension Bridge 
• Grouse Grind
• Flying Beaver, fabulous little pub on the river (free shuttle service)


Combining spectacular natural beauty and a prime waterfront location, Vancouver has captivated the imagination of travelers the world over. Surrounded by the Pacific Ocean and the Coastal Mountains, Mother Nature pulled out all the stops when she created “Canada’s Golden Child”. Vancouver is an experience, not a vacation, and you have to see it to believe it. 

At Dejavu you are just steps away from an adventure that you’ll treasure forever…
________________________________________

”it reminds us of home” - Brigitte & Gerard, Paris, France (2011)

______________________ Cantonese, as well as a little Mandarin and Spanish. ________________________________________

________________________________________

NOTE: If calendar is full, please message us. We may be able to accommodate you in one of our other listings. 

________________________________________

Please welcome our new team member, Manuel, all the way from Barcelona ;) I

The space
If you're looking for a clean room in a safe and convenient neighborhood close to both the airport as well as the bustling culture and plethora of dining options that central Richmond has to offer, then stay at Dejavu!

We are just steps to the bus stop. From there it's a 5-minute ride to Richmond Center and the Canada Line which whizzes you downtown in less than half an hour. We are less than 10 minutes from Vancouver and also from the airport by car.
You will have use of the outdoor pool (seasonal), deck and outdoor fireplace (GAS STOVE NOT INCLUDED). Since Covid we do not offer meals. The bathroom may be shared depending on whether or not we have other guests at the same time. We offer wifi and free visitor parking.
••••••••
We have a small dog who is very friendly and well-behaved. Be forewarned, he will probably bark at you upon your arrival, but give it a couple of minutes and he'll be wanting you to play ball with him. Our little guy is non-shedding so people allergic to pet fur are typically fine around him.
